who_apply.title: WHO SHOULD APPLY TO A-STAR?
who_apply.sub_title: Given below is a pre-requisite list for potential companies

col_1.title: Potential to integrate AI into existing business model
col_1.content: As part of our selection process; our AI expert committee will evaluate whether there is a strong fit and potential for existing companies to integrate AI into their current business models and if AI can help companies unlock new values without causing disruption to their existing operations.

col_2.title: TEAM'S READINESS AND QUALIFICATIONS
col_2.content: Another critical selection criteria is for us to understand if the team is truly ready to apply AI into their business model in the near future. This touches multiple aspects of the companies: founders and leaderships’ willingness to take this big paradigm shift, and existing qualification of current tech team and their capacity to take on this new skill in the near term.

col_3.title: IDEAL PARTICIPANTS
col_3.content: Our A-star bootcamp program is designed for founders (both technical and non technical), founding members of startups that have already launched their products / services to the market and looking to scale. The program is also suitable for senior leadership members from big corporations who are looking to transform their businesses using AI.

groups.title: Program Advisor
groups.description: Provide general advice to startups and help engage company leaders with AI Advisors and AI Expert Buddies.

mentors.name: Dr. Thang Luong
mentors.title:
• Senior Staff Research Scientist at Google DeepMind
  • Co-founder of NTI
  • GStar Program Director
mentors.description: Thang Luong is currently a Senior Staff Research Scientist and Senior Manager at Google DeepMind, formerly Google Brain. He obtained his PhD in Computer Science from Stanford University in 2016, during which he pioneered the field of deep learning for machine translation. At Google, Dr. Luong built state-of-the-art models in both language (QANet, ELECTRA) and vision (UDA, NoisyStudent). He co-founded Project Meena, which debuted the world's best chatbot in 2020 and later became Google LaMDA chatbot in 2021. Dr. Luong has been co-leading the development of Bard Multimodality since 2022 and is the principal investigator of the AlphaGeometry project (published in Nature, 2024) that solves Olympiad-level geometry problems and competes at the International Mathematical Olympiad (IMO). Recently, he leads the Superhuman Reasoning team at Google to built the first AI that reaches Silver medalist level at IMO 2024.

mentors.name: Dr. Yi Tay
mentors.title:
• Scientist & Engineer at Google DeepMind
  • GStar Overall Technical Lead
mentors.description:
Yi Tay is a Senior Staff Research Scientist at Google DeepMind, previously spending over three years at Google Brain Singapore, where he contributed to cutting-edge research on large language models (LLMs) and NLP. He is also a co-founder of Reka AI, where his team developed Reka Core, a model that ranked in the top 5 on LMsys and competed with GPT-4 under limited resources.
Yi Tay's work explores emergent abilities, scaling laws, and the science behind LLMs, combining academic rigor with real-world applications. Passionate about advancing AI, he continues to push the boundaries of trustworthy, scalable, and efficient language models.

mentors.name: Dr. Jeff Dean
mentors.title:
• Chief Scientist of Google Research and Google DeepMind
  • GStar Senior Advisor
mentors.description: Jeff Dean, a distinguished figure in the realm of computer science, has made significant and lasting contributions to the field of artificial intelligence (AI). His work at Google, where he currently serves as the head of Google AI, has been instrumental in propelling the company to the forefront of AI research and development. A true visionary, Dean was one of the founding members of Google Brain, a team that pioneered the development of large-scale artificial neural networks, a cornerstone of modern AI systems. His expertise and leadership have played a pivotal role in shaping Google's AI strategy and have solidified his position as a leading voice in the AI community.

mentors.name: Prof. Christopher D. Manning
mentors.title:
• Professor of Machine Learning and NLP at Stanford University
  • GStar Senior Advisor
mentors.description: Christopher D. Manning is the Thomas M. Siebel Professor in Machine Learning and Professor of Linguistics and Computer Science at Stanford University, and Associate Director of the Stanford Institute for Human-Centered AI (HAI). He leads the Stanford NLP Group and developed widely used tools such as Stanford CoreNLP and Stanza. Manning is a pioneer in natural language processing, driving the transition from statistical methods to deep learning, with key contributions to GloVe embeddings, attention mechanisms, and neural architectures that shaped models like transformers, BERT, and GPT. He co-authored foundational textbooks and created the popular course CS224N: NLP with Deep Learning.

mentors.name: Prof. Preslav Nakov
mentors.title:
• Department Chair and Professor of Natural Language Processing at MBZUAI
  • GStar Senior Advisor
mentors.description:
Preslav Nakov is Professor and Department Chair for NLP at the Mohamed bin Zayed University of Artificial Intelligence (MBZUAI). His research focuses on natural language processing, with a particular interest in large language models. He is part of the core team at MBZUAI's Institute for Foundation Models that developed Jais, the world's best open-source Arabic-centric LLM, Nanda, the world's best open-weights Hindi model, Sherkala, the world's best open-weights Kazakh model, and LLM360, the first truly open LLM (open weights, open data, and open code).

A prominent figure in computational linguistics, he is Chair of the European Chapter of the Association for Computational Linguistics (EACL). He served as Program Committee Chair for ACL 2022, as President of ACL SIGLEX, as Secretary of SIGSLAV, and holds editorial roles across leading NLP and AI journals. His research has been featured in MIT Technology Review, Forbes, WIRED, Fast Company, and Communications of the ACM, among others.

mentors.name: Prof. Graham Neubig
mentors.title:
• Associate Professor at the School of Computer Science, Carnegie Mellon University
  • GStar Guest Lecturer
mentors.description: Graham Neubig is an Associate Professor at the Language Technology Institute, School of Computer Science, Carnegie Mellon University, and serves as Chief Scientist at All Hands AI. He leads NeuLab, focusing on advancing machine learning and natural language processing (NLP) through foundational research and practical systems. His expertise spans multilingual language processing, question answering, code generation, and interpretable learning. Neubig has also developed widely used open-source software for NLP applications and regularly shares class and tutorial notes to support the community. He is known for delivering invited talks on LLM-powered agents and model evaluation at leading venues including CMU, Stanford, and UIUC.

mentors.name: Prof. Danqi Chen
mentors.title:
• Associate Professor of Computer Science at Princeton University
  • GStar Guest Lecturer
mentors.description: Danqi Chen is an Associate Professor of Computer Science at Princeton University and co-leads the Princeton NLP Group. She also serves as Associate Director of Princeton’s Language and Intelligence initiative, which drives foundational research on large AI models. Her expertise centers on deep learning for natural language processing—particularly in areas like text understanding, knowledge representation, question answering, and retrieval-augmented models to improve model factuality and interpretability. Before joining Princeton, she was a visiting scientist at Facebook AI Research, earned her Ph.D. at Stanford (2018) under Christopher Manning, and her B.E. at Tsinghua University.

mentors.name: Prof. Po-Shen Loh
mentors.title:
• Professor of Mathematics at Carnegie Mellon University
  • GStar Guest Lecturer on Leadership
mentors.description: Po‑Shen Loh is a Professor of Mathematics at Carnegie Mellon University, a social entrepreneur, and Vice President of the IMO Foundation. From 2013 to 2023, he served as national coach of the USA International Mathematical Olympiad team, guiding them to multiple first‑place victories. Loh also founded Expii, a free AI‑powered math education platform, and developed NOVID, a pandemic‑control app built on innovative network theory. His research spans combinatorics, probability theory, and computer science, and he has been recognized with honours including the Presidential Early Career Award for Scientists and Engineers. Loh travels globally, engaging over 10,000 people annually with lectures and creative problem‑solving courses.

mentors.name: Jing Yu Koh
mentors.title:
• Research Scientist & Tech Lead of Llama Computer Control Agents Team at Meta
  • GStar Guest Lecturer
mentors.description: Jing Yu Koh is a Research Scientist and the tech lead for Meta’s LLaMA computer-control agents team, where she collaborates with Ruslan Salakhutdinov to build general-purpose agents capable of automating computer tasks. She is currently on leave from her Ph.D. in Machine Learning at Carnegie Mellon University. Previously, she conducted research at Google Research on vision-and-language modeling and generative systems, and completed her undergraduate studies at the Singapore University of Technology and Design, summa cum laude.

mentors.name: Dr. Tiep Nguyen
mentors.title:
• Lecturer at University of Information Technology
  • Head of Academics at NTI
  • GStar Academic Team
mentors.description: Dr. Nguyen Vinh Tiep is currently a lecturer and head of the Multimedia Communications Lab at the University of Information Technology – Vietnam National University, Ho Chi Minh City (VNU-HCM). He earned his PhD from the University of Information Technology, VNU-HCM. His areas of expertise include Computer Vision and Machine Learning, with numerous research contributions and mentorship of students in practical, application-driven projects. Prof. Tiệp is deeply passionate about education, especially in inspiring research and developing AI skills among students and young learners.

mentors.name: Prof. Tu Vu
mentors.title:
• Assistant Professor at Virginia Tech
  • Head of Research at NTI
  • GStar Academic Team
mentors.description: Prof. Tu Vu is currently an Assistant Professor of Computer Science at Virginia Tech and a Faculty Researcher at Google. He earned his PhD from the University of Massachusetts Amherst under the supervision of Mohit Iyyer and previously worked as a Research Scientist at Google DeepMind. His research aims to advance and democratize artificial intelligence in the era of large language models (LLMs), with a focus on improving core LLM capabilities such as reasoning and instruction following, as well as their use in evaluation (e.g., LLM-as-a-Critic). He is also deeply engaged in transfer learning across tasks, modalities, and languages; efficient model updating with factual and real-time information; and parameter-efficient adaptation of LLMs to new domains, especially in low-resource settings. He actively bridges research and real-world impact through both academic mentorship and industrial collaboration, with a long-term vision of making powerful AI systems more accessible, adaptable, and aligned.

mentors.name: Hoang Tran
mentors.title:
• Research Engineer at OpenAI
  • Head of Industry at NTI
  • GStar Academic Team
mentors.description: Hoang Tran is currently a research engineer at OpenAI. He was previously a research scientist at Snorkel AI, where he developed a state‑of‑the‑art, open‑source LLM that topped Stanford AI Lab - Tatsu Lab's AlpacaEval leaderboard, and he presented this work at NVIDIA GTC 2024. At Snorkel, he also advised Fortune 500 enterprises on building custom LLMs and agentic systems. In 2020, Hoang co‑founded Vizly, a design‑feedback startup selected for the Mozilla Foundation's Fix‑the‑Internet Spring MVP Lab.

mentors.name: Chien Nguyen
mentors.title:
• PhD student in Computer Science at the University of Oregon
  • GStar Academic Team
mentors.description: Chien Nguyen is a Ph.D. student in Computer Science at the University of Oregon, specializing in Natural Language Processing (NLP), Large Language Models (LLMs), and generative AI. Previously, he was a Research Resident at VinAI Research, where he worked on information extraction and the development of multilingual LLMs. Chien has co-authored multiple papers at ACL, EMNLP, and COLING, including CulturaX, one of the largest multilingual datasets for LLM training, and Okapi, a framework for instruction-tuning LLMs with RLHF in 26 languages. He also lectures on advanced NLP and LLMs at VietAI. His current research explores large-scale generative models, multimodal learning, and cross-lingual transfer techniques.

mentors.name: Long Phan
mentors.title:
• Research Engineer at the Center for AI Safety
  • GStar Academic Team
mentors.description: Long Phan is a Research Engineer at the Center for AI Safety, working with Dan Hendrycks on advancing AI Safety and robustness. He earned his B.S. in Computer Science from Case Western Reserve University in 2023, where he collaborated with Trieu H. Trinh and Minh-Thang Luong (DeepMind). Long has contributed to influential projects such as HarmBench, a standardized framework for automated red teaming, Representation Engineering, and Circuit Breakers for improving alignment and robustness. He is also a co-author on large-scale initiatives like BLOOM and multilingual models, and his research spans LLMs, transparency, and safety evaluations. Long's work has appeared in ACL, NAACL, EACL, and leading AI conferences.

processes.description:
Click APPLY to fill the registration form. In this form, we expect to learn more about your company, milestones, & primary roadblocks in terms of applying AI to your business model. Please respond carefully with your best effort.

To achieve great outcomes, we expect at least two members (1 business & 1 tech lead/executive) per company to enroll in our program. For us to fully evaluate the company's potential, we expect to get detailed answers jointly by 1 business & 1 tech lead/executive. Only 1 submission per company.
